caption:
This photograph captures a tranquil, somber scene set in a cemetery. In the forefront, various gravestones and monuments of different styles and sizes are scattered across the ground. Some stones are upright, others are flat, and one particularly large tomb in the foreground has a cylindrical shape adorned with engraved patterns.

The middle ground of the photo features a small white church, characterized by its simple architectural design. The church has a gabled roof and a small bell tower or cupola at the top, suggesting that it might serve a central role in the cemetery's community activities. The church has long, vertical window openings which are symmetrically placed along its sidewalls, contributing to its modest yet classic aesthetic.

In the background, leafless trees suggest that the season is either fall or winter, providing a stark, somewhat bleak backdrop that enhances the solemnity of the cemetery setting. The sky is overcast, cast in gray tones that meld seamlessly with the subdued hues of the surroundings.

Overall, the composition of the photograph, with its focus on the church nestled among graves and the natural landscape in muted colors, evokes a peaceful yet melancholic atmosphere, reflective of a place meant for remembrance and quiet contemplation.
title: This cemetery and church form an oasis surrounded by miles of stripped land in southeast Ohio near Steubenville.  The church has been repainted as a public relations effort by the hanna coal company.  The company hopes to encourage use of the church, even though no one lives nearby
